ygData.subject: Re: AAs in parenting
ygData.msgSnippet: I used to love doing traeskills til i reached about 190 lol.. I have 191 in baking, 135 in tailoring, 100 in smithing, 80 in brewing and 62 in jewellery. I
ygData.messageBody:
I used to love doing traeskills til i reached about 190 lol.. I have
191 in baking, 135 in tailoring, 100 in smithing, 80 in brewing and
62 in jewellery. I have found now though with wu's needing so many
ingrediesnt for a single combine that it has turned me off of
tailoring, same with smithing. Baking is still fun but when u have
to make 35 patty melts to lvl up it becomes kind of annoying. And my
bank *faints* there was never any room in it..lol filled with eggs
and misty picnic ingredients, vials of viscous mana..nope i need a
break but for all those out there..i say try and have fun with it.
my friends enjoy my skills =). ps i have 110 AA's in parenting


--- In EQ_women@yahoogroups.com, Mary Beth <lilock@y...> wrote:
> I enjoy doing trade skills very rarely. I will however get in
these moods where I will want to do them. I've been working on my
cleric's faction to start her shawls. She was ally with giants for
a long time while my guild was hunting in Ntov (kael armor). Two
ring wars later and a bunch of dead giants I think I am ready to
begin serious trade skilling for that shawl. :)
>
> Baking has always been my favourite of all the trades. Its fairly
easy, a lot of the components for the great stat food come from some
wonderful exp spots, and the food you can make is very beneficial!
I haven't tried smithing but www.eqtraders.com may be a spot to look
if you haven't heard of that website!
>
> ~MB
>
> Brangvyne Accampo <brangvyne7@y...> wrote:
> Salutations!
>
> We used to talk about adopting a lot but we just kept
> having more kids instead, so we adopted them.
> :o)
>
> I have no time management skills. Nothing ever gets
> done on time or properly. I figure as long as it
> eventually happens it successful.
>
> Congratulations on 62. As someone who recently hit 62
> myself we seem to be taking the same road. Last night
> I took my 21% into 62 and my 65 ranger hubby and went
> to HoH. Why HoH instead of BoT. Well simple. He can
> solo there bow kiting the mobs till they die. It's a
> bit slow but I keep him healed and toss in a few 1100
> point nukes to speed the process and its not bad at
> all. The two of us were killing mobs with between 30K
> and 75K hp. So my recipie now is BoT if I can get a
> good group, HoH if I'm duoing, and trade skills etc.
> when I'm alone. Working out pretty good.
>
> Finished my fourth coldain shawl yesterday, but I need
> to get my tailoring up some more before I try that 5th
> one. Only 101, and although I know it trivs at 115 I
> think I'm going to triv Wu's armor at 158 before I
> make the attempt. After all it will need to be higher
> later anyway, so might as well get it on up now.
>
> Do we have any others who like to do that trade stuff
> on the list. I do it a lot when it's slow. Just work
> on this or that to pass the time. I like the easy
> recipies though even if they cost me more. After all
> it's not hard to make a few thousand plat if I really
> need to. And along that line, does anyone know a
> simple smithing recipie to use from 88. I just made
> shields till 88. It was easy and all the parts could
> be gotten in one convient spot. Now I'm looking for
> something simple. But baking is the easiest to raise
> if you're bored and don't mind sitting around for a
> while. Fish cakes to 135 (a hearty meal), I caught the
> fish and bought the bat wings. Storm salmon to 202
> (stat food) but I'm forgetting what I have to put with
> it. That's a lot of fish I'll tell you though. Again
> you just have to have the patience for the fishing in
> PoS. Anyway just my cooking tip of the day.
> :oP
>
> /Hugs
> Bran
>
> --- "Dr. Mom" <drmom5@v...> wrote:
> > I am considering foster parenting. But the local
> > agency never calls me
> > back. Hmmm.
> >
> > Time management, secret shopping has taught me
> > organizational skills! But
> > online forms don't let you mess up.
> >
> > Ding 62 this afternoon. Now I put it all in AA and
> > go to BoT tomorrow AM.
> >
> >
> > ____>situation. I think I'm level 65 with a couple
> > hundred
> > ____>AA's now in motherhood.
> > ____>:oP
> > ____>
> > ____>And the other night we we're discussing the
> > ____>possibility of a number 8.
> >
> >
> >
> > -------------------------------------
